Louis de France, Son of France, Duke of Burgundy, 1682 A-1712. Eldest son of Louis

KW699508 Louis de France, Son of France, Duke of Burgundy, 1682 A-1712. Eldest son of Louis, Dauphin of France, and known as Le Petit Dauphin. From Les Heures Libres published 1908. by French School, (20th century); Private Collection; Ken Welsh; French, out of copyright

Media ID 12924176

© www.bridgemanimages.com

Louis de France, Son of France - A Glimpse into Royal Legacy

EDITORS COMMENTS

. This print showcases Louis de France, the illustrious Duke of Burgundy, in all his regal splendor. Born in 1682 as the eldest son of Louis, Dauphin of France, he was affectionately known as Le Petit Dauphin. This exquisite engraving from Les Heures Libres published in 1908 offers a timeless glimpse into the life and legacy of this influential figure. Dressed in opulent attire befitting his royal lineage, Louis de France exudes an air of confidence and grace. His piercing gaze reveals both wisdom beyond his years and a sense of duty to uphold the grandeur associated with being part of the French monarchy. The fine details captured by this photograph print allow us to appreciate not only the physical features but also the intricate craftsmanship that went into creating such an extraordinary piece. Every line etched on his face tells a story; every brushstroke adds depth to his character. As we gaze upon this remarkable image, we are transported back to a time when power and prestige were intertwined with birthright. It serves as a reminder that history is shaped not only by great events but also by individuals like Louis de France who played their part in shaping nations. This print is more than just an artistic representation; it is a testament to human ambition and resilience—a window into an era long gone yet forever imprinted on our collective memory.
